*div1 type="summary"* *p*Thomas F. McKinney to Austin, Nacogdoches, March 14, 1828. Efforts of a disgruntled vagabond to disturb the country. High-handed proceedings of the military commandant, Piedras.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Nacodoches */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="03-14-1828">March 14 1828*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dier sir*/p*
*p*yours of the *date_mentioned n="01-29-1828">29th of Jany*/date_mentioned* has been over looked in the *location_mentioned*post office*/location_mentioned* until this *date_mentioned n="03-14-1828">morning */date_mentioned*otherwise I should have immediately complied with your request I do assure you I am at all times ready to check when in my power any thing like perturbattion of the *person_mentioned*inhabitants*/person_mentioned* not only of your *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*but any other part of the *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*my sincere disire is that the *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*prospers and any thing which would have a contrary effect would be repugnant to my feelings*/p*
*p*That *person_mentioned*Dayton */person_mentioned*has made an attempt to raise a *person_mentioned*party */person_mentioned*there is no doubt though from the best information we can get on the subject there has not more than eight or ten *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*been so base as to join him—*person_mentioned*Dayton's */person_mentioned*respectability in your *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*is much more extensive than in any part of this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and the general opinon is that the only revenge he seeks is to practise villiany be it of whatsoever nature or at whatsoever place that opportunity may serve a few men have been provoked to connive at his attempt from the treatment they have received in this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*because that *person_mentioned*Dayton*/person_mentioned* declared he would commit outrages upon this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*would bring down the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*upon them and other threats to that purport.*/p*
*p*In *date_mentioned n="12-xx-1827">December last*/date_mentioned* there was a [daj] designated for the *person_mentioned*inhabitants*/person_mentioned* [to meet for the] purpose of swearing allegiance [to the State Constitution?] *person_mentioned*Burril Thompson*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Demi . . . ed */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Burrel */person_mentioned*mani- fested [some reluctance to] take the necessary oath and ... his hand to assign his name a[nd] ... the day when *person_mentioned*Piedras */person_mentioned*who w[as presiding?] . . . snatched the list from his [hand. Piedras ordered?] him and Hase to march forthwith for the *location_mentioned*uni-?]ted States*/location_mentioned* without any charfges being made] against them? or any oportunity [given them for any] kind of defence it is unnecessary to say to you that such a course was productive of displeasure among the *person_mentioned*inhabitants*/person_mentioned* and until this day the cause of their banishment is unknown. The *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*who accompanied *person_mentioned*Piedras */person_mentioned*for the purpose of cooperating in his measures was applied to in order to ascertain the motives or the crime of which those men were charged his reply was that he was not consulted in the matter nor was the cause made known to him and he himself disapproved of the course.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Piedras */person_mentioned*has persued an arbitrary course during his time here and the civil *person_mentioned*authorities */person_mentioned*of the place have hitherto been no obstacle in his progressions though the extreme weakness of the *person_mentioned*individuals*/person_mentioned* in whom those *person_mentioned*authorities */person_mentioned*are reposed serve in some measure as an apology for his doing so provided he proceeded correctly himself. For some imprudent conduct of the *person_mentioned*Coles */person_mentioned*and others to *person_mentioned*Elisha Roberts*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*which conduct amounted to nothing more than hooping and howling as aparcel of *person_mentioned*blackguards*/person_mentioned* frequently do and killing a dog of *person_mentioned*Roberts*/person_mentioned*'s they were arrested by the *person_mentioned*Military */person_mentioned*put in strings conducted to *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*commited to *location_mentioned*prison */location_mentioned*bail refused without a trial for something like ten days when the trial commenced by the *person_mentioned*Military */person_mentioned*and the *person_mentioned*prisoners */person_mentioned*asked [for] permission to interogate the *person_mentioned*witnesses */person_mentioned*who replied in [a harsh and?] haughty manner that he would proceed ... or custom of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned* and during their [trial] frequently was heard say that it seemed [to him that] *person_mentioned*americans */person_mentioned*were accustomed to treat the [officers? with] disrespect though he had brought [a guard with?] him and would sustain him self that . . . had acted cowardly in consequence of . . . was now in disrepute and many other . . . vincing that he wished to awe or [intimidate the] *person_mentioned*inhabitants */person_mentioned*into obedience . . . kind were productive of nothing good . . . *person_mentioned*Ahumado */person_mentioned*is still venerated among us and he could effect more here with his walking staff than *person_mentioned*Piedras */person_mentioned*with all his bayonets. It is to be regreted that *person_mentioned*Piedras */person_mentioned*brought with him to this place prejudices against the *person_mentioned*American inhabts*/person_mentioned* which will be difficult to remove.*/p*
*p*Another circumstance which produced considerable excitement was two men engaged in a combat when an old *person_mentioned*gambler */person_mentioned*by the name of *person_mentioned*ward */person_mentioned*interfered in order to make peace at which time a *person_mentioned*soldier*/person_mentioned* arrived with his bayonet in his hand and observing a pocket knife in *person_mentioned*Wards */person_mentioned*hand and he engauged peremptorily ordered him to put the knife in his pocket *person_mentioned*Ward */person_mentioned*did not understand only from his manner which was menacing and did not obey the order until spoken by an *person_mentioned*American */person_mentioned*who explained to him what the *person_mentioned*soldier */person_mentioned*had said *person_mentioned*Ward*/person_mentioned* immediately put the knife in his pocket though by this time the *person_mentioned*combatants */person_mentioned*had retired the *person_mentioned*soldier */person_mentioned*proceeded to call a *person_mentioned*guard */person_mentioned*who arrived *person_mentioned*Ward */person_mentioned*was pointed out by the insulted *person_mentioned*soldier */person_mentioned*to the guard who without any thing like an inquiry proceeded to beat *person_mentioned*Ward */person_mentioned*with their muskets in a beastly manner broke his arm in two places in that situation conducted him to *location_mentioned*prison*/location_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Piedras */person_mentioned*observed he would make a fit subject for sweeping the streets for the next six months and it was with difficulty that he could be prevailed upon after being informed of the circumstances to let *person_mentioned*Ward */person_mentioned*out of *location_mentioned*prison */location_mentioned*these circumstances I witnessed myself and if *person_mentioned*Ward */person_mentioned*had been a respectable m[an] . . . the excitement which prefvailed] . . . would have been serious ... He is now punishing a *person_mentioned*citizen */person_mentioned*. . . ducting from this place . . . giving him a certain num[ber] . . . making him carry a chai[n] . . . man deserves punishmen[t] ... to do so the truth of . . . There is nothing like money . . . *person_mentioned*inhabitants */person_mentioned**person_mentioned*Piedras */person_mentioned*has been borrowing on the faith of the Gov1 for some time past and his paper is in circulation for the amount of several thousand dollars still the inhabitants are satisfied that he has a quantity of money on hand and are at a loss to know his motive for retaining it some of us are rather suspicious of his principles and rather doubt his attachment to the Govt though we may not be justifiable in so doing it is a thing which we by no means make publick*/p*
*p*I should be glad to hear from you relative to your trip to the *location_mentioned*interior */location_mentioned*the probable success of our*location_mentioned* Ayish Byou */location_mentioned*petición when we may hope for relief of those who are in suspence in this *location_mentioned*quarter*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Thomas F McKinney */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
